verbs.description: uncongeal (third-person singular simple present uncongeals, present participle uncongealing, simple past and past participle uncongealed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To become liquid again; to thaw.
examples: 1833–1834 (date written)​,  Alfred Tennyson,  “The Two Voices”, in  Poems. […], volume II, London: Edward Moxon, […], published 1842, →OCLC, page 143:Like soften'd airs that blowing steal, / When meres begin to uncongeal, / The sweet church bells began to peal.
